me.lerch.alexa.state.model

Class AlexaStateModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.lerch.alexa.state.model.AlexaStateModel

  • public abstract class AlexaStateModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class turns your POJO model into a model compatible to the AlexaStateHandler.

      AlexaStateModel()

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlexaStateModel

        public AlexaStateModel()

    • Method Detail

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.String id)
        Sets an id for this model instance. The id should be an unique identifier within a model-type within an AlexaScope. This is how you can persist multiple instances per model per user or per application or per session. An id has some regulations to its allowed characters (a-zA-Z0-9_-.)
        Parameters:
        id - an identifier for this model instance.

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Gets id for this model instance. The id is an unique identifier within a model-type within an AlexaScope. This is how you can a specific instance for a model in either scope of user or application or session.
        Returns:
        identifier which can also be null for singleton model instances

      • setHandler

        public void setHandler(AlexaStateHandler handler)
        Sets the AlexaStateHandler which takes care of this model when it saveState(), removeState() or loadState(). A state handler usually is dedicated to a persistence store which stores the AlexaStateSave-tagged fields of this model
        Parameters:
        handler - a state handler implementation

      • withHandler

        public AlexaStateModel withHandler(AlexaStateHandler handler)
        Sets the AlexaStateHandler which takes care of this model when it saveState(), removeState() or loadState(). A state handler usually is dedicated to a persistence store which stores the AlexaStateSave-tagged fields of this model
        Parameters:
        handler - a state handler implementation
        Returns:
        abstract representation of your model

      • getHandler

        public AlexaStateHandler getHandler()
        Gets the AlexaStateHandler which takes care of this model when it saveState(), removeState() or loadState(). A state handler usually is dedicated to a persistence store which stores the AlexaStateSave-tagged fields of this model
        Returns:
        the state handler

      • saveState

        public void saveState()
               throws AlexaStateException
        Asks the state handler associated with this model to save all AlexaStateSave-tagged fields in the persistence store. This method will raise an exception if no handler is set for this model.
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • loadState

        public void loadState()
               throws AlexaStateException
        Asks the state handler associated with this model to load values out of the persistence store into all AlexaStateSave-tagged fields of this model. It will overwrite the current values of those fields. This method will raise an exception if no handler is set for this model.
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • removeState

        public void removeState()
                 throws AlexaStateException
        Asks the state handler associated with this model to remove the model from the persistence store. It means you won't be able to access the model with its id anymore. There is no impact on the runtime instance. Its values remain.
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.reflect.Field field)
                     throws AlexaStateException
        Generic getter for all the fields in this model. A field needs to be either public or must have a public getter following the naming convention getFieldname() in order to return its value. If there's a problem with accessing the value this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        field - The field whose value you desire. It must be publically accessible at least through a getter-method and of course must be owned by the model class.
        Returns:
        Value of the given field.
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • set

        public java.lang.Boolean set(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                             java.lang.Object value)
                      throws AlexaStateException
        Generic setter for all the fields in this model. A field needs to be either public or must have a public setter following the naming convention setFieldname in order to assign the value given. If there's a problem with accessing the value this method returns false
        Parameters:
        field - The field whose value you want to set. It must be publically accessible at least through a setter-method and of course must be owned by the model class.
        value - New value for the given field
        Returns:
        True, if value was set successfully.
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • fromJSON

        public boolean fromJSON(java.lang.String json)
                 throws AlexaStateException
        Expects a json-string which contains keys with values. Any key which is equal a fieldname of this model will result in its value being written to the field of this model. Those fields needs to have the AlexaStateSave-annotation otherwise they will not be considered even though there name match with a key in the given json.
        Parameters:
        json - A json with key-value-pairs where the keys likely equal some of the AlexaStateSave-tagged fields in this model.
        Returns:
        True, if json-keys matched with AlexaStateSave-tagged fields.
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • fromJSON

        public boolean fromJSON(java.lang.String json,
                        AlexaScope scope)
                 throws AlexaStateException
        Expects a json-string which contains keys with values. Any key which is equal a fieldname of this model will result in its value being written to the field of this model. Those fields needs to have the AlexaStateSave-annotation with the given scope otherwise they will not be considered even though there name match with a key in the given json.
        Parameters:
        json - A json with key-value-pairs where the keys likely equal some of the AlexaStateSave-tagged with given scope fields in this model.
        scope - The scope a AlexaStateSave-annotated field must have to be considered for value assignment
        Returns:
        True, if json-keys matched with AlexaStateSave-tagged fields with given scope.
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • toJSON

        public java.lang.String toJSON(AlexaScope scope)
                        throws AlexaStateException
        Returns a json with key-value-pairs - one for each AlexaStateSave-annotated field in this model configured to be valid in the given scope
        Parameters:
        scope - The scope a AlexaStateSave-annotated field must have or be part of to be considered in the returned json
        Returns:
        A json-string with key-value-pairs - one for each AlexaStateSave-annotated field in this model configured to be valid
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • toMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> toMap(AlexaScope scope)
                                                       throws AlexaStateException
        Returns a map with key-value-pairs - one for each AlexaStateSave-annotated field in this model configured to be valid in the given scope
        Parameters:
        scope - The scope a AlexaStateSave-annotated field must have or be part of to be considered in the returned map
        Returns:
        A map with key-value-pairs - one for each AlexaStateSave-annotated field in this model configured to be valid
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • hasSessionScopedField

        public java.lang.Boolean hasSessionScopedField()
        It returns if any AlexaStateSave field is in the model scoped in SESSION
        Returns:
        True, if there are any AlexaStateSave fields in the model scoped in SESSION

      • hasUserScopedField

        public java.lang.Boolean hasUserScopedField()
        It returns if any AlexaStateSave field is in the model scoped in USER
        Returns:
        True, if there are any AlexaStateSave fields in the model scoped in USER

      • hasApplicationScopedField

        public java.lang.Boolean hasApplicationScopedField()
        It returns if any AlexaStateSave field is in the model scoped in APPLICATION
        Returns:
        True, if there are any AlexaStateSave fields in the model scoped in APPLICATION

      • getSaveStateFields

        public java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> getSaveStateFields()
        Gives you all the fields of this model which are annotated with AlexaStateSave
        Returns:
        list of all the fields of this model which are annotated with AlexaStateSave

      • getSaveStateFields

        public java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> getSaveStateFields(AlexaScope scope)
        Gives you all the fields of this model which are annotated with AlexaStateSave and whose scope is set to a scope which at least in included in the given scope.
        Parameters:
        scope - Defines the scope which is used to filter all the AlexaStateSave-annotated fields
        Returns:
        list of all the fields of this model which are annotated with AlexaStateSave and whose scope is set to a scope which at least in included in the given scope.
